intro: Schnarfia messeniaca, commonly known as the Messenian Schnarfia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Greece. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates with mild summers and cold winters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Schnarfia messeniaca is considered a vulnerable species, facing threats from habitat loss and climate change.
